physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal vital signs and oxygen saturation reported.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Oropharyngeal mucosa had a cobblestone appearance, and scattered inspiratory wheezes throughout lung fields were noted. Peak expiratory flow rate was 400 liters per minute (predicted value, 470).

physical_examinations.vital_signs: The physical examination was normal, without wheezing, cyanosis, clubbing, or lymphadenopathy.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pulmonary-function tests were normal: FVC 3.45 liters (101% predicted), FEV1 2.62 liters (97%), FEV1/FVC 0.76, total lung capacity 5.30 liters (97%).
CT of the chest was largely unchanged since the last evaluation, with an 8-mm nodule seen in the left apex.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: CT findings were unchanged from the initial evaluation.
